00069 /*
00070 [ENUM]
00071 [
00072     [DESCRIPTION]   
00073     On failure of commands in FMOD, use FSOUND_GetError to attain what happened.
00074     
00075     [SEE_ALSO]      
00076     FSOUND_GetError
00077 ]
00078 */
00079 enum FMOD_ERRORS 
00080 {
00081     FMOD_ERR_NONE,             /* No errors */
00082     FMOD_ERR_BUSY,             /* Cannot call this command after FSOUND_Init.  Call FSOUND_Close first. */
00083     FMOD_ERR_UNINITIALIZED,    /* This command failed because FSOUND_Init or FSOUND_SetOutput was not called */
00084     FMOD_ERR_INIT,             /* Error initializing output device. */
00085     FMOD_ERR_ALLOCATED,        /* Error initializing output device, but more specifically, the output device is already in use and cannot be reused. */
00086     FMOD_ERR_PLAY,             /* Playing the sound failed. */
00087     FMOD_ERR_OUTPUT_FORMAT,    /* Soundcard does not support the features needed for this soundsystem (16bit stereo output) */
00088     FMOD_ERR_COOPERATIVELEVEL, /* Error setting cooperative level for hardware. */
00089     FMOD_ERR_CREATEBUFFER,     /* Error creating hardware sound buffer. */
00090     FMOD_ERR_FILE_NOTFOUND,    /* File not found */
00091     FMOD_ERR_FILE_FORMAT,      /* Unknown file format */
00092     FMOD_ERR_FILE_BAD,         /* Error loading file */
00093     FMOD_ERR_MEMORY,           /* Not enough memory or resources */
00094     FMOD_ERR_VERSION,          /* The version number of this file format is not supported */
00095     FMOD_ERR_INVALID_PARAM,    /* An invalid parameter was passed to this function */
00096     FMOD_ERR_NO_EAX,           /* Tried to use an EAX command on a non EAX enabled channel or output. */
00097     FMOD_ERR_CHANNEL_ALLOC,    /* Failed to allocate a new channel */
00098     FMOD_ERR_RECORD,           /* Recording is not supported on this machine */
00099     FMOD_ERR_MEDIAPLAYER,      /* Windows Media Player not installed so cannot play wma or use internet streaming. */
00100     FMOD_ERR_CDDEVICE          /* An error occured trying to open the specified CD device */
00101 };

00104 /*
00105 [ENUM]
00106 [
00107     [DESCRIPTION]   
00108     These output types are used with FSOUND_SetOutput, to choose which output driver to use.
00109     
00110     FSOUND_OUTPUT_DSOUND will not support hardware 3d acceleration if the sound card driver 
00111     does not support DirectX 6 Voice Manager Extensions.
00112 
00113     FSOUND_OUTPUT_WINMM is recommended for NT and CE.
00114 
00115     [SEE_ALSO]      
00116     FSOUND_SetOutput
00117     FSOUND_GetOutput
00118 ]
00119 */
00120 enum FSOUND_OUTPUTTYPES
00121 {
00122     FSOUND_OUTPUT_NOSOUND,    /* NoSound driver, all calls to this succeed but do nothing. */
00123     FSOUND_OUTPUT_WINMM,      /* Windows Multimedia driver. */
00124     FSOUND_OUTPUT_DSOUND,     /* DirectSound driver.  You need this to get EAX2 or EAX3 support, or FX api support. */
00125     FSOUND_OUTPUT_A3D,        /* A3D driver. */
00126 
00127     FSOUND_OUTPUT_OSS,        /* Linux/Unix OSS (Open Sound System) driver, i.e. the kernel sound drivers. */
00128     FSOUND_OUTPUT_ESD,        /* Linux/Unix ESD (Enlightment Sound Daemon) driver. */
00129     FSOUND_OUTPUT_ALSA,       /* Linux Alsa driver. */
00130 
00131     FSOUND_OUTPUT_ASIO,       /* Low latency ASIO driver */
00132     FSOUND_OUTPUT_XBOX,       /* Xbox driver */
00133     FSOUND_OUTPUT_PS2,        /* PlayStation 2 driver */
00134     FSOUND_OUTPUT_MAC,        /* Mac SoundManager driver */
00135     FSOUND_OUTPUT_GC,         /* Gamecube driver */
00136     FSOUND_OUTPUT_PSP,        /* PlayStation Portable driver */
00137 
00138     FSOUND_OUTPUT_NOSOUND_NONREALTIME   /* This is the same as nosound, but the sound generation is driven by FSOUND_Update */
00139 };

00142 /*
00143 [ENUM]
00144 [
00145     [DESCRIPTION]   
00146     These mixer types are used with FSOUND_SetMixer, to choose which mixer to use, or to act 
00147     upon for other reasons using FSOUND_GetMixer.
00148     It is not nescessary to set the mixer.  FMOD will autodetect the best mixer for you.
00149 
00150     [SEE_ALSO]      
00151     FSOUND_SetMixer
00152     FSOUND_GetMixer
00153 ]
00154 */
00155 enum FSOUND_MIXERTYPES
00156 {
00157     FSOUND_MIXER_AUTODETECT,        /* CE/PS2/GC Only - Non interpolating/low quality mixer. */
00158     FSOUND_MIXER_BLENDMODE,         /* Removed / obsolete. */
00159     FSOUND_MIXER_MMXP5,             /* Removed / obsolete. */
00160     FSOUND_MIXER_MMXP6,             /* Removed / obsolete. */
00161 
00162     FSOUND_MIXER_QUALITY_AUTODETECT,/* All platforms - Autodetect the fastest quality mixer based on your cpu. */
00163     FSOUND_MIXER_QUALITY_FPU,       /* Win32/Linux only - Interpolating/volume ramping FPU mixer.  */
00164     FSOUND_MIXER_QUALITY_MMXP5,     /* Win32/Linux only - Interpolating/volume ramping P5 MMX mixer.  */
00165     FSOUND_MIXER_QUALITY_MMXP6,     /* Win32/Linux only - Interpolating/volume ramping ppro+ MMX mixer. */
00166 
00167     FSOUND_MIXER_MONO,              /* CE/PS2/GC only - MONO non interpolating/low quality mixer. For speed*/
00168     FSOUND_MIXER_QUALITY_MONO,      /* CE/PS2/GC only - MONO Interpolating mixer.  For speed */
00169 
00170     FSOUND_MIXER_MAX
00171 };

00196 /*
00197 [DEFINE_START] 
00198 [
00199     [NAME] 
00200     FSOUND_DSP_PRIORITIES
00201 
00202     [DESCRIPTION]   
00203     These default priorities are used by FMOD internal system DSP units.  They describe the 
00204     position of the DSP chain, and the order of how audio processing is executed.
00205     You can actually through the use of FSOUND_DSP_GetxxxUnit (where xxx is the name of the DSP
00206     unit), disable or even change the priority of a DSP unit.
00207 
00208     [SEE_ALSO]      
00209     FSOUND_DSP_Create
00210     FSOUND_DSP_SetPriority
00211     FSOUND_DSP_GetSpectrum
00212 ]
00213 */
00214 #define FSOUND_DSP_DEFAULTPRIORITY_CLEARUNIT        0       /* DSP CLEAR unit - done first */
00215 #define FSOUND_DSP_DEFAULTPRIORITY_SFXUNIT          100     /* DSP SFX unit - done second */
00216 #define FSOUND_DSP_DEFAULTPRIORITY_MUSICUNIT        200     /* DSP MUSIC unit - done third */
00217 #define FSOUND_DSP_DEFAULTPRIORITY_USER             300     /* User priority, use this as reference for your own DSP units */
00218 #define FSOUND_DSP_DEFAULTPRIORITY_FFTUNIT          900     /* This reads data for FSOUND_DSP_GetSpectrum, so it comes after user units */
00219 #define FSOUND_DSP_DEFAULTPRIORITY_CLIPANDCOPYUNIT  1000    /* DSP CLIP AND COPY unit - last */
00220 /* [DEFINE_END] */
00221 
00222 
00223 /*
00224 [DEFINE_START] 
00225 [
00226     [NAME] 
00227     FSOUND_CAPS
00228 
00229     [DESCRIPTION]   
00230     Driver description bitfields.  Use FSOUND_Driver_GetCaps to determine if a driver enumerated
00231     has the settings you are after.  The enumerated driver depends on the output mode, see
00232     FSOUND_OUTPUTTYPES
00233 
00234     [SEE_ALSO]
00235     FSOUND_GetDriverCaps
00236     FSOUND_OUTPUTTYPES
00237 ]
00238 */
00239 #define FSOUND_CAPS_HARDWARE                0x1     /* This driver supports hardware accelerated 3d sound. */
00240 #define FSOUND_CAPS_EAX2                    0x2     /* This driver supports EAX 2 reverb */
00241 #define FSOUND_CAPS_EAX3                    0x10    /* This driver supports EAX 3 reverb */
00242 /* [DEFINE_END] */
00243 
00244 
00245 /*
00246 [DEFINE_START] 
00247 [
00248     [NAME] 
00249     FSOUND_MODES
00250     
00251     [DESCRIPTION]   
00252     Sample description bitfields, OR them together for loading and describing samples.
00253     NOTE.  If the file format being loaded already has a defined format, such as WAV or MP3, then 
00254     trying to override the pre-defined format with a new set of format flags will not work.  For
00255     example, an 8 bit WAV file will not load as 16bit if you specify FSOUND_16BITS.  It will just
00256     ignore the flag and go ahead loading it as 8bits.  For these type of formats the only flags
00257     you can specify that will really alter the behaviour of how it is loaded, are the following.
00258     ---------
00259     Looping behaviour - FSOUND_LOOP_OFF, FSOUND_LOOP_NORMAL, FSOUND_LOOP_BIDI 
00260     Load destination - FSOUND_HW3D, FSOUND_HW2D, FSOUND_2D
00261     Loading behaviour - FSOUND_NONBLOCKING, FSOUND_LOADMEMORY, FSOUND_LOADRAW, FSOUND_MPEGACCURATE, FSOUND_MPEGHALFRATE, FSOUND_FORCEMONO
00262     Playback behaviour - FSOUND_STREAMABLE, FSOUND_ENABLEFX
00263     PlayStation 2 only - FSOUND_USECORE0, FSOUND_USECORE1, FSOUND_LOADMEMORYIOP    
00264     ---------
00265     See flag descriptions for what these do.
00266 ]
00267 */
00268 #define FSOUND_LOOP_OFF      0x00000001  /* For non looping samples. */
00269 #define FSOUND_LOOP_NORMAL   0x00000002  /* For forward looping samples. */
00270 #define FSOUND_LOOP_BIDI     0x00000004  /* For bidirectional looping samples.  (no effect if in hardware). */
00271 #define FSOUND_8BITS         0x00000008  /* For 8 bit samples. */
00272 #define FSOUND_16BITS        0x00000010  /* For 16 bit samples. */
00273 #define FSOUND_MONO          0x00000020  /* For mono samples. */
00274 #define FSOUND_STEREO        0x00000040  /* For stereo samples. */
00275 #define FSOUND_UNSIGNED      0x00000080  /* For user created source data containing unsigned samples. */
00276 #define FSOUND_SIGNED        0x00000100  /* For user created source data containing signed data. */
00277 #define FSOUND_DELTA         0x00000200  /* For user created source data stored as delta values. */
00278 #define FSOUND_IT214         0x00000400  /* For user created source data stored using IT214 compression. */
00279 #define FSOUND_IT215         0x00000800  /* For user created source data stored using IT215 compression. */
00280 #define FSOUND_HW3D          0x00001000  /* Attempts to make samples use 3d hardware acceleration. (if the card supports it) */
00281 #define FSOUND_2D            0x00002000  /* Tells software (not hardware) based sample not to be included in 3d processing. */
00282 #define FSOUND_STREAMABLE    0x00004000  /* For a streamimg sound where you feed the data to it. */
00283 #define FSOUND_LOADMEMORY    0x00008000  /* "name" will be interpreted as a pointer to data for streaming and samples. */
00284 #define FSOUND_LOADRAW       0x00010000  /* Will ignore file format and treat as raw pcm. */
00285 #define FSOUND_MPEGACCURATE  0x00020000  /* For FSOUND_Stream_Open - for accurate FSOUND_Stream_GetLengthMs/FSOUND_Stream_SetTime.  WARNING, see FSOUND_Stream_Open for inital opening time performance issues. */
00286 #define FSOUND_FORCEMONO     0x00040000  /* For forcing stereo streams and samples to be mono - needed if using FSOUND_HW3D and stereo data - incurs a small speed hit for streams */
00287 #define FSOUND_HW2D          0x00080000  /* 2D hardware sounds.  allows hardware specific effects */
00288 #define FSOUND_ENABLEFX      0x00100000  /* Allows DX8 FX to be played back on a sound.  Requires DirectX 8 - Note these sounds cannot be played more than once, be 8 bit, be less than a certain size, or have a changing frequency */
00289 #define FSOUND_MPEGHALFRATE  0x00200000  /* For FMODCE only - decodes mpeg streams using a lower quality decode, but faster execution */
00290 #define FSOUND_IMAADPCM      0x00400000  /* Contents are stored compressed as IMA ADPCM */
00291 #define FSOUND_VAG           0x00800000  /* For PS2 only - Contents are compressed as Sony VAG format */
00292 #define FSOUND_NONBLOCKING   0x01000000  /* For FSOUND_Stream_Open/FMUSIC_LoadSong - Causes stream or music to open in the background and not block the foreground app.  See FSOUND_Stream_GetOpenState or FMUSIC_GetOpenState to determine when it IS ready. */
00293 #define FSOUND_GCADPCM       0x02000000  /* For Gamecube only - Contents are compressed as Gamecube DSP-ADPCM format */
00294 #define FSOUND_MULTICHANNEL  0x04000000  /* For PS2 and Gamecube only - Contents are interleaved into a multi-channel (more than stereo) format */
00295 #define FSOUND_USECORE0      0x08000000  /* For PS2 only - Sample/Stream is forced to use hardware voices 00-23 */
00296 #define FSOUND_USECORE1      0x10000000  /* For PS2 only - Sample/Stream is forced to use hardware voices 24-47 */
00297 #define FSOUND_LOADMEMORYIOP 0x20000000  /* For PS2 only - "name" will be interpreted as a pointer to data for streaming and samples.  The address provided will be an IOP address */
00298 #define FSOUND_IGNORETAGS    0x40000000  /* Skips id3v2 etc tag checks when opening a stream, to reduce seek/read overhead when opening files (helps with CD performance) */
00299 #define FSOUND_STREAM_NET    0x80000000  /* Specifies an internet stream */
00300 
00301 #define FSOUND_NORMAL       (FSOUND_16BITS | FSOUND_SIGNED | FSOUND_MONO)      
00302 /* [DEFINE_END] */
00303

00306 /*
00307 [DEFINE_START] 
00308 [
00309     [NAME] 
00310     FSOUND_CDPLAYMODES
00311     
00312     [DESCRIPTION]   
00313     Playback method for a CD Audio track, with FSOUND_CD_SetPlayMode
00314 
00315     [SEE_ALSO]    
00316     FSOUND_CD_SetPlayMode  
00317     FSOUND_CD_Play
00318 ]
00319 */
00320 #define FSOUND_CD_PLAYCONTINUOUS    0   /* Starts from the current track and plays to end of CD. */
00321 #define FSOUND_CD_PLAYONCE          1   /* Plays the specified track then stops. */
00322 #define FSOUND_CD_PLAYLOOPED        2   /* Plays the specified track looped, forever until stopped manually. */
00323 #define FSOUND_CD_PLAYRANDOM        3   /* Plays tracks in random order */
00324 /* [DEFINE_END] */

00326 
00327 /*
00328 [DEFINE_START] 
00329 [
00330     [NAME] 
00331     FSOUND_MISC_VALUES
00332     
00333     [DESCRIPTION]
00334     Miscellaneous values for FMOD functions.
00335 
00336     [SEE_ALSO]
00337     FSOUND_PlaySound
00338     FSOUND_PlaySoundEx
00339     FSOUND_Sample_Alloc
00340     FSOUND_Sample_Load
00341     FSOUND_SetPan
00342 ]
00343 */
00344 #define FSOUND_FREE             -1      /* value to play on any free channel, or to allocate a sample in a free sample slot. */
00345 #define FSOUND_UNMANAGED        -2      /* value to allocate a sample that is NOT managed by FSOUND or placed in a sample slot. */
00346 #define FSOUND_ALL              -3      /* for a channel index , this flag will affect ALL channels available!  Not supported by every function. */
00347 #define FSOUND_STEREOPAN        -1      /* value for FSOUND_SetPan so that stereo sounds are not played at half volume.  See FSOUND_SetPan for more on this. */
00348 #define FSOUND_SYSTEMCHANNEL    -1000   /* special 'channel' ID for all channel based functions that want to alter the global FSOUND software mixing output channel */
00349 #define FSOUND_SYSTEMSAMPLE     -1000   /* special 'sample' ID for all sample based functions that want to alter the global FSOUND software mixing output sample */
00350 
00351 /* [DEFINE_END] */
00352 
00353 
00354 /*
00355 [STRUCTURE] 
00356 [
00357     [DESCRIPTION]
00358     Structure defining a reverb environment.
00359     For more indepth descriptions of the reverb properties under win32, please see the EAX2 and EAX3
00360     documentation at http://developer.creative.com/ under the 'downloads' section.
00361     If they do not have the EAX3 documentation, then most information can be attained from
00362     the EAX2 documentation, as EAX3 only adds some more parameters and functionality on top of EAX2.
00363     Note the default reverb properties are the same as the FSOUND_PRESET_GENERIC preset.
00364     Note that integer values that typically range from -10,000 to 1000 are represented in decibels, and are of a logarithmic scale, not linear, wheras float values are typically linear.
00365     PORTABILITY: Each member has the platform it supports in braces ie (win32/xbox).  
00366     Some reverb parameters are only supported in win32 and some only on xbox. If all parameters are set then the reverb should product a similar effect on either platform.
00367     
00368     The numerical values listed below are the maximum, minimum and default values for each variable respectively.
00369 
00370     [SEE_ALSO]
00371     FSOUND_Reverb_SetProperties
00372     FSOUND_Reverb_GetProperties
00373     FSOUND_REVERB_PRESETS
00374     FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS
00375 ]
00376 */
00377 typedef struct _FSOUND_REVERB_PROPERTIES /* MIN     MAX    DEFAULT   DESCRIPTION */
00378 {                                   
00379     unsigned int Environment;            /* 0     , 25    , 0      , sets all listener properties (WIN32/PS2 only) */
00380     float        EnvSize;                /* 1.0   , 100.0 , 7.5    , environment size in meters (WIN32 only) */
00381     float        EnvDiffusion;           /* 0.0   , 1.0   , 1.0    , environment diffusion (WIN32/XBOX) */
00382     int          Room;                   /* -10000, 0     , -1000  , room effect level (at mid frequencies) (WIN32/XBOX/PS2) */
00383     int          RoomHF;                 /* -10000, 0     , -100   , relative room effect level at high frequencies (WIN32/XBOX) */
00384     int          RoomLF;                 /* -10000, 0     , 0      , relative room effect level at low frequencies (WIN32 only) */
00385     float        DecayTime;              /* 0.1   , 20.0  , 1.49   , reverberation decay time at mid frequencies (WIN32/XBOX) */
00386     float        DecayHFRatio;           /* 0.1   , 2.0   , 0.83   , high-frequency to mid-frequency decay time ratio (WIN32/XBOX) */
00387     float        DecayLFRatio;           /* 0.1   , 2.0   , 1.0    , low-frequency to mid-frequency decay time ratio (WIN32 only) */
00388     int          Reflections;            /* -10000, 1000  , -2602  , early reflections level relative to room effect (WIN32/XBOX) */
00389     float        ReflectionsDelay;       /* 0.0   , 0.3   , 0.007  , initial reflection delay time (WIN32/XBOX) */
00390     float        ReflectionsPan[3];      /*       ,       , [0,0,0], early reflections panning vector (WIN32 only) */
00391     int          Reverb;                 /* -10000, 2000  , 200    , late reverberation level relative to room effect (WIN32/XBOX) */
00392     float        ReverbDelay;            /* 0.0   , 0.1   , 0.011  , late reverberation delay time relative to initial reflection (WIN32/XBOX) */
00393     float        ReverbPan[3];           /*       ,       , [0,0,0], late reverberation panning vector (WIN32 only) */
00394     float        EchoTime;               /* .075  , 0.25  , 0.25   , echo time (WIN32/PS2 only.  PS2 = Delay time for ECHO/DELAY modes only) */
00395     float        EchoDepth;              /* 0.0   , 1.0   , 0.0    , echo depth (WIN32/PS2 only.  PS2 = Feedback level for ECHO mode only) */
00396     float        ModulationTime;         /* 0.04  , 4.0   , 0.25   , modulation time (WIN32 only) */
00397     float        ModulationDepth;        /* 0.0   , 1.0   , 0.0    , modulation depth (WIN32 only) */
00398     float        AirAbsorptionHF;        /* -100  , 0.0   , -5.0   , change in level per meter at high frequencies (WIN32 only) */
00399     float        HFReference;            /* 1000.0, 20000 , 5000.0 , reference high frequency (hz) (WIN32/XBOX) */
00400     float        LFReference;            /* 20.0  , 1000.0, 250.0  , reference low frequency (hz) (WIN32 only) */
00401     float        RoomRolloffFactor;      /* 0.0   , 10.0  , 0.0    , like FSOUND_3D_SetRolloffFactor but for room effect (WIN32/XBOX) */
00402     float        Diffusion;              /* 0.0   , 100.0 , 100.0  , Value that controls the echo density in the late reverberation decay. (XBOX only) */
00403     float        Density;                /* 0.0   , 100.0 , 100.0  , Value that controls the modal density in the late reverberation decay (XBOX only) */
00404     unsigned int Flags;                  /* FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS - modifies the behavior of above properties (WIN32/PS2 only) */
00405 } FSOUND_REVERB_PROPERTIES;
00406 
00407 
00408 /*
00409 [DEFINE_START] 
00410 [
00411     [NAME] 
00412     FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS
00413     
00414     [DESCRIPTION]
00415     Values for the Flags member of the FSOUND_REVERB_PROPERTIES structure.
00416 
00417     [SEE_ALSO]
00418     FSOUND_REVERB_PROPERTIES
00419 ]
00420 */
00421 #define FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_DECAYTIMESCALE        0x00000001 /* 'EnvSize' affects reverberation decay time */
00422 #define FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_REFLECTIONSSCALE      0x00000002 /* 'EnvSize' affects reflection level */
00423 #define FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_REFLECTIONSDELAYSCALE 0x00000004 /* 'EnvSize' affects initial reflection delay time */
00424 #define FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_REVERBSCALE           0x00000008 /* 'EnvSize' affects reflections level */
00425 #define FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_REVERBDELAYSCALE      0x00000010 /* 'EnvSize' affects late reverberation delay time */
00426 #define FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_DECAYHFLIMIT          0x00000020 /* AirAbsorptionHF affects DecayHFRatio */
00427 #define FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_ECHOTIMESCALE         0x00000040 /* 'EnvSize' affects echo time */
00428 #define FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_MODULATIONTIMESCALE   0x00000080 /* 'EnvSize' affects modulation time */
00429 #define FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_CORE0                 0x00000100 /* PS2 Only - Reverb is applied to CORE0 (hw voices 0-23) */
00430 #define FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_CORE1                 0x00000200 /* PS2 Only - Reverb is applied to CORE1 (hw voices 24-47) */
00431 #define FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_DEFAULT              (FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_DECAYTIMESCALE |        \
00432                                                   FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_REFLECTIONSSCALE |      \
00433                                                   FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_REFLECTIONSDELAYSCALE | \
00434                                                   FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_REVERBSCALE |           \
00435                                                   FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_REVERBDELAYSCALE |      \
00436                                                   FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_DECAYHFLIMIT |          \
00437                                                   FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_CORE0 |                 \
00438                                                   FSOUND_REVERB_FLAGS_CORE1 )
00439 /* [DEFINE_END] */

00505 
00506 
00507 /*
00508 [STRUCTURE] 
00509 [
00510     [DESCRIPTION]
00511     Structure defining the properties for a reverb source, related to a FSOUND channel.
00512     For more indepth descriptions of the reverb properties under win32, please see the EAX3
00513     documentation at http://developer.creative.com/ under the 'downloads' section.
00514     If they do not have the EAX3 documentation, then most information can be attained from
00515     the EAX2 documentation, as EAX3 only adds some more parameters and functionality on top of 
00516     EAX2.
00517     
00518     Note the default reverb properties are the same as the FSOUND_PRESET_GENERIC preset.
00519     Note that integer values that typically range from -10,000 to 1000 are represented in 
00520     decibels, and are of a logarithmic scale, not linear, wheras float values are typically linear.
00521     PORTABILITY: Each member has the platform it supports in braces ie (win32/xbox).  
00522     Some reverb parameters are only supported in win32 and some only on xbox. If all parameters are set then
00523     the reverb should product a similar effect on either platform.
00524     Linux and FMODCE do not support the reverb api.
00525     
00526     The numerical values listed below are the maximum, minimum and default values for each variable respectively.
00527 
00528     [SEE_ALSO]
00529     FSOUND_Reverb_SetChannelProperties
00530     FSOUND_Reverb_GetChannelProperties
00531     FSOUND_REVERB_CHANNELFLAGS
00532 ]
00533 */
00534 typedef struct _FSOUND_REVERB_CHANNELPROPERTIES /* MIN     MAX    DEFAULT */
00535 {                                   
00536     int    Direct;                              /* -10000, 1000,  0,    direct path level (at low and mid frequencies) (WIN32/XBOX) */
00537     int    DirectHF;                            /* -10000, 0,     0,    relative direct path level at high frequencies (WIN32/XBOX) */
00538     int    Room;                                /* -10000, 1000,  0,    room effect level (at low and mid frequencies) (WIN32/XBOX/PS2) */
00539     int    RoomHF;                              /* -10000, 0,     0,    relative room effect level at high frequencies (WIN32/XBOX) */
00540     int    Obstruction;                         /* -10000, 0,     0,    main obstruction control (attenuation at high frequencies)  (WIN32/XBOX) */
00541     float  ObstructionLFRatio;                  /* 0.0,    1.0,   0.0,  obstruction low-frequency level re. main control (WIN32/XBOX) */
00542     int    Occlusion;                           /* -10000, 0,     0,    main occlusion control (attenuation at high frequencies) (WIN32/XBOX) */
00543     float  OcclusionLFRatio;                    /* 0.0,    1.0,   0.25, occlusion low-frequency level re. main control (WIN32/XBOX) */
00544     float  OcclusionRoomRatio;                  /* 0.0,    10.0,  1.5,  relative occlusion control for room effect (WIN32) */
00545     float  OcclusionDirectRatio;                /* 0.0,    10.0,  1.0,  relative occlusion control for direct path (WIN32) */
00546     int    Exclusion;                           /* -10000, 0,     0,    main exlusion control (attenuation at high frequencies) (WIN32) */
00547     float  ExclusionLFRatio;                    /* 0.0,    1.0,   1.0,  exclusion low-frequency level re. main control (WIN32) */
00548     int    OutsideVolumeHF;                     /* -10000, 0,     0,    outside sound cone level at high frequencies (WIN32) */
00549     float  DopplerFactor;                       /* 0.0,    10.0,  0.0,  like DS3D flDopplerFactor but per source (WIN32) */
00550     float  RolloffFactor;                       /* 0.0,    10.0,  0.0,  like DS3D flRolloffFactor but per source (WIN32) */
00551     float  RoomRolloffFactor;                   /* 0.0,    10.0,  0.0,  like DS3D flRolloffFactor but for room effect (WIN32/XBOX) */
00552     float  AirAbsorptionFactor;                 /* 0.0,    10.0,  1.0,  multiplies AirAbsorptionHF member of FSOUND_REVERB_PROPERTIES (WIN32) */
00553     int    Flags;                               /* FSOUND_REVERB_CHANNELFLAGS - modifies the behavior of properties (WIN32) */
00554 } FSOUND_REVERB_CHANNELPROPERTIES;
00555 
00556 
00557 /*
00558 [DEFINE_START] 
00559 [
00560     [NAME] 
00561     FSOUND_REVERB_CHANNELFLAGS
00562     
00563     [DESCRIPTION]
00564     Values for the Flags member of the FSOUND_REVERB_CHANNELPROPERTIES structure.
00565 
00566     [SEE_ALSO]
00567     FSOUND_REVERB_CHANNELPROPERTIES
00568 ]
00569 */
00570 #define FSOUND_REVERB_CHANNELFLAGS_DIRECTHFAUTO  0x00000001 /* Automatic setting of 'Direct'  due to distance from listener */
00571 #define FSOUND_REVERB_CHANNELFLAGS_ROOMAUTO      0x00000002 /* Automatic setting of 'Room'  due to distance from listener */
00572 #define FSOUND_REVERB_CHANNELFLAGS_ROOMHFAUTO    0x00000004 /* Automatic setting of 'RoomHF' due to distance from listener */
00573 #define FSOUND_REVERB_CHANNELFLAGS_DEFAULT       (FSOUND_REVERB_CHANNELFLAGS_DIRECTHFAUTO |   \
00574                                                   FSOUND_REVERB_CHANNELFLAGS_ROOMAUTO|        \
00575                                                   FSOUND_REVERB_CHANNELFLAGS_ROOMHFAUTO)
00576 /* [DEFINE_END] */
00577 
00578 
00579 /*
00580 [ENUM] 
00581 [
00582     [DESCRIPTION]
00583     These values are used with FSOUND_FX_Enable to enable DirectX 8 FX for a channel.
00584 
00585     [SEE_ALSO]
00586     FSOUND_FX_Enable
00587     FSOUND_FX_Disable
00588     FSOUND_FX_SetChorus
00589     FSOUND_FX_SetCompressor
00590     FSOUND_FX_SetDistortion
00591     FSOUND_FX_SetEcho
00592     FSOUND_FX_SetFlanger
00593     FSOUND_FX_SetGargle
00594     FSOUND_FX_SetI3DL2Reverb
00595     FSOUND_FX_SetParamEQ
00596     FSOUND_FX_SetWavesReverb
00597 ]
00598 */
00599 enum FSOUND_FX_MODES
00600 {
00601     FSOUND_FX_CHORUS,
00602     FSOUND_FX_COMPRESSOR,
00603     FSOUND_FX_DISTORTION,
00604     FSOUND_FX_ECHO,
00605     FSOUND_FX_FLANGER,
00606     FSOUND_FX_GARGLE,
00607     FSOUND_FX_I3DL2REVERB,
00608     FSOUND_FX_PARAMEQ,
00609     FSOUND_FX_WAVES_REVERB,
00610 
00611     FSOUND_FX_MAX
00612 };
00613 
00614 /*
00615 [ENUM]
00616 [
00617     [DESCRIPTION]   
00618     These are speaker types defined for use with the FSOUND_SetSpeakerMode command.
00619     Note - Only reliably works with FSOUND_OUTPUT_DSOUND or FSOUND_OUTPUT_XBOX output modes.  Other output modes will only 
00620     interpret FSOUND_SPEAKERMODE_MONO and set everything else to be stereo.
00621 
00622     Using either DolbyDigital or DTS will use whatever 5.1 digital mode is available if destination hardware is unsure.
00623 
00624     [SEE_ALSO]
00625     FSOUND_SetSpeakerMode
00626 
00627 ]
00628 */
00629 enum FSOUND_SPEAKERMODES
00630 {
00631     FSOUND_SPEAKERMODE_DOLBYDIGITAL,        /* Dolby Digital Output (XBOX or PC only). */
00632     FSOUND_SPEAKERMODE_HEADPHONES,          /* The speakers are headphones. */
00633     FSOUND_SPEAKERMODE_MONO,                /* The speakers are monaural. */
00634     FSOUND_SPEAKERMODE_QUAD,                /* The speakers are quadraphonic.  */
00635     FSOUND_SPEAKERMODE_STEREO,              /* The speakers are stereo (default value). */
00636     FSOUND_SPEAKERMODE_SURROUND,            /* The speakers are surround sound. */
00637     FSOUND_SPEAKERMODE_DTS,                 /* DTS output (XBOX only). */
00638     FSOUND_SPEAKERMODE_PROLOGIC2,           /* Dolby Prologic 2.  Playstation 2 and Gamecube only.  PlayStation 2 doesnt support interior panning, but supports 48 voices simultaneously. */
00639     FSOUND_SPEAKERMODE_PROLOGIC2_INTERIOR   /* Dolby Prologic 2.  Playstation 2 and Gamecube only.  PlayStation 2 does support interior panning, but only supports 24 voices simultaneously. */
00640 };
00641 
00642 
00643 /*
00644 [DEFINE_START] 
00645 [
00646     [NAME] 
00647     FSOUND_INIT_FLAGS
00648     
00649     [DESCRIPTION]   
00650     Initialization flags.  Use them with FSOUND_Init in the flags parameter to change various behaviour.
00651     
00652     FSOUND_INIT_ENABLESYSTEMCHANNELFX Is an init mode which enables the FSOUND mixer buffer to be affected by DirectX 8 effects.
00653     Note that due to limitations of DirectSound, FSOUND_Init may fail if this is enabled because the buffersize is too small.
00654     This can be fixed with FSOUND_SetBufferSize.  Increase the BufferSize until it works.
00655     When it is enabled you can use the FSOUND_FX api, and use FSOUND_SYSTEMCHANNEL as the channel id when setting parameters.
00656 
00657     [SEE_ALSO]
00658     FSOUND_Init
00659 ]
00660 */
00661 #define FSOUND_INIT_USEDEFAULTMIDISYNTH     0x0001    /* Win32 only - Causes MIDI playback to force software decoding. */
00662 #define FSOUND_INIT_GLOBALFOCUS             0x0002    /* Win32 only - For DirectSound output - sound is not muted when window is out of focus. */
00663 #define FSOUND_INIT_ENABLESYSTEMCHANNELFX   0x0004    /* Win32 only - For DirectSound output - Allows FSOUND_FX api to be used on global software mixer output! (use FSOUND_SYSTEMCHANNEL as channel id) */
00664 #define FSOUND_INIT_ACCURATEVULEVELS        0x0008    /* This latency adjusts FSOUND_GetCurrentLevels, but incurs a small cpu and memory hit */
00665 #define FSOUND_INIT_PS2_DISABLECORE0REVERB  0x0010    /* PS2 only   - Disable reverb on CORE 0 (SPU2 voices 00-23) to regain SRAM */
00666 #define FSOUND_INIT_PS2_DISABLECORE1REVERB  0x0020    /* PS2 only   - Disable reverb on CORE 1 (SPU2 voices 24-47) to regain SRAM */
00667 #define FSOUND_INIT_PS2_SWAPDMACORES        0x0040    /* PS2 only   - By default FMOD uses DMA CH0 for mixing, CH1 for uploads, this flag swaps them around */
00668 #define FSOUND_INIT_DONTLATENCYADJUST       0x0080    /* Callbacks are not latency adjusted, and are called at mix time.  Also information functions are immediate */
00669 #define FSOUND_INIT_GC_INITLIBS             0x0100    /* GC only    - Initializes GC audio libraries */
00670 #define FSOUND_INIT_STREAM_FROM_MAIN_THREAD 0x0200    /* Turns off fmod streamer thread, and makes streaming update from FSOUND_Update called by the user */
00671 #define FSOUND_INIT_PS2_USEVOLUMERAMPING    0x0400    /* PS2 only   - Turns on volume ramping system to remove hardware clicks. */
00672 #define FSOUND_INIT_DSOUND_DEFERRED         0x0800    /* Win32 only - For DirectSound output.  3D commands are batched together and executed at FSOUND_Update. */
00673 #define FSOUND_INIT_DSOUND_HRTF_LIGHT       0x1000    /* Win32 only - For DirectSound output.  FSOUND_HW3D buffers use a slightly higher quality algorithm when 3d hardware acceleration is not present. */
00674 #define FSOUND_INIT_DSOUND_HRTF_FULL        0x2000    /* Win32 only - For DirectSound output.  FSOUND_HW3D buffers use full quality 3d playback when 3d hardware acceleration is not present. */
00675 #define FSOUND_INIT_XBOX_REMOVEHEADROOM     0x4000    /* XBox only - By default directsound attenuates all sound by 6db to avoid clipping/distortion.  CAUTION.  If you use this flag you are responsible for the final mix to make sure clipping / distortion doesn't happen. */
00676 #define FSOUND_INIT_PSP_SILENCEONUNDERRUN   0x8000    /* PSP only - If streams skip / stutter when device is powered on, either increase stream buffersize, or use this flag instead to play silence while the UMD is recovering. */
00677 /* [DEFINE_END] */
00678 
00679 
00680 /*
00681 [ENUM]
00682 [
00683     [DESCRIPTION]   
00684     Status values for internet streams. Use FSOUND_Stream_Net_GetStatus to get the current status of an internet stream.
00685 
00686     [SEE_ALSO]
00687     FSOUND_Stream_Net_GetStatus
00688 ]
00689 */
00690 enum FSOUND_STREAM_NET_STATUS
00691 {
00692     FSOUND_STREAM_NET_NOTCONNECTED = 0,     /* Stream hasn't connected yet */
00693     FSOUND_STREAM_NET_CONNECTING,           /* Stream is connecting to remote host */
00694     FSOUND_STREAM_NET_BUFFERING,            /* Stream is buffering data */
00695     FSOUND_STREAM_NET_READY,                /* Stream is ready to play */
00696     FSOUND_STREAM_NET_ERROR                 /* Stream has suffered a fatal error */
00697 };
00698 
00699 
00700 /*
00701 [ENUM]
00702 [
00703     [DESCRIPTION]   
00704     Describes the type of a particular tag field.
00705 
00706     [SEE_ALSO]
00707     FSOUND_Stream_GetNumTagFields
00708     FSOUND_Stream_GetTagField
00709     FSOUND_Stream_FindTagField
00710 ]
00711 */
00712 enum FSOUND_TAGFIELD_TYPE
00713 {
00714     FSOUND_TAGFIELD_VORBISCOMMENT = 0,      /* A vorbis comment */
00715     FSOUND_TAGFIELD_ID3V1,                  /* Part of an ID3v1 tag */
00716     FSOUND_TAGFIELD_ID3V2,                  /* An ID3v2 frame */
00717     FSOUND_TAGFIELD_SHOUTCAST,              /* A SHOUTcast header line */
00718     FSOUND_TAGFIELD_ICECAST,                /* An Icecast header line */
00719     FSOUND_TAGFIELD_ASF                     /* An Advanced Streaming Format header line */
00720 };
00721 
00722 
00723 /*
00724 [DEFINE_START] 
00725 [
00726     [NAME] 
00727     FSOUND_STATUS_FLAGS
00728     
00729     [DESCRIPTION]   
00730     These values describe the protocol and format of an internet stream. Use FSOUND_Stream_Net_GetStatus to retrieve this information for an open internet stream.
00731     
00732     [SEE_ALSO]
00733     FSOUND_Stream_Net_GetStatus
00734 ]
00735 */
00736 #define FSOUND_PROTOCOL_SHOUTCAST   0x00000001
00737 #define FSOUND_PROTOCOL_ICECAST     0x00000002
00738 #define FSOUND_PROTOCOL_HTTP        0x00000004
00739 #define FSOUND_FORMAT_MPEG          0x00010000
00740 #define FSOUND_FORMAT_OGGVORBIS     0x00020000
00741 /* [DEFINE_END] */
00742 
00743 
00744 /*
00745 [STRUCTURE] 
00746 [
00747     [DESCRIPTION]
00748     Structure defining a CD table of contents. This structure is returned as a tag from FSOUND_Stream_FindTagField when the tag name "CD_TOC" is specified.
00749     Note: All tracks on the CD - including data tracks- will be represented in this structure so it's use for anything other than generating disc id information is not recommended.
00750     See the cdda example program for info on retrieving and using this structure.
00751 
00752     [SEE_ALSO]
00753     FSOUND_Stream_Open
00754     FSOUND_Stream_FindTagField
00755 ]
00756 */
00757 typedef struct _FSOUND_TOC_TAG
00758 {
00759     char name[4];                           /* The string "TOC", just in case this structure is accidentally treated as a string */
00760     int  numtracks;                         /* The number of tracks on the CD */
00761     int  min[100];                          /* The start offset of each track in minutes */
00762     int  sec[100];                          /* The start offset of each track in seconds */
00763     int  frame[100];                        /* The start offset of each track in frames */
00764 
00765 } FSOUND_TOC_TAG;

00959 /* =================== */
00960 /* FX functions.       */
00961 /* =================== */
00962 
00963 /* 
00964     Functions to control DX8 only effects processing.
00965 
00966     - FX enabled samples can only be played once at a time, not multiple times at once.
00967     - Sounds have to be created with FSOUND_HW2D or FSOUND_HW3D for this to work.
00968     - FSOUND_INIT_ENABLESYSTEMCHANNELFX can be used to apply hardware effect processing to the
00969       global mixed output of FMOD's software channels.
00970     - FSOUND_FX_Enable returns an FX handle that you can use to alter fx parameters.
00971     - FSOUND_FX_Enable can be called multiple times in a row, even on the same FX type,
00972       it will return a unique handle for each FX.
00973     - FSOUND_FX_Enable cannot be called if the sound is playing or locked.
00974     - FSOUND_FX_Disable must be called to reset/clear the FX from a channel.
00975 */
00976 
00977 DLL_API int             F_API FSOUND_FX_Enable(int channel, unsigned int fxtype);    /* See FSOUND_FX_MODES */
00978 DLL_API signed char     F_API FSOUND_FX_Disable(int channel);                        /* Disables all effects */
00979 
00980 DLL_API signed char     F_API FSOUND_FX_SetChorus(int fxid, float WetDryMix, float Depth, float Feedback, float Frequency, int Waveform, float Delay, int Phase);
00981 DLL_API signed char     F_API FSOUND_FX_SetCompressor(int fxid, float Gain, float Attack, float Release, float Threshold, float Ratio, float Predelay);
00982 DLL_API signed char     F_API FSOUND_FX_SetDistortion(int fxid, float Gain, float Edge, float PostEQCenterFrequency, float PostEQBandwidth, float PreLowpassCutoff);
00983 DLL_API signed char     F_API FSOUND_FX_SetEcho(int fxid, float WetDryMix, float Feedback, float LeftDelay, float RightDelay, int PanDelay);
00984 DLL_API signed char     F_API FSOUND_FX_SetFlanger(int fxid, float WetDryMix, float Depth, float Feedback, float Frequency, int Waveform, float Delay, int Phase);
00985 DLL_API signed char     F_API FSOUND_FX_SetGargle(int fxid, int RateHz, int WaveShape);
00986 DLL_API signed char     F_API FSOUND_FX_SetI3DL2Reverb(int fxid, int Room, int RoomHF, float RoomRolloffFactor, float DecayTime, float DecayHFRatio, int Reflections, float ReflectionsDelay, int Reverb, float ReverbDelay, float Diffusion, float Density, float HFReference);
00987 DLL_API signed char     F_API FSOUND_FX_SetParamEQ(int fxid, float Center, float Bandwidth, float Gain);
00988 DLL_API signed char     F_API FSOUND_FX_SetWavesReverb(int fxid, float InGain, float ReverbMix, float ReverbTime, float HighFreqRTRatio);  
00989  
00990 /* ========================= */
00991 /* File Streaming functions. */

00993 
00994 /*
00995     Note : Use FSOUND_LOADMEMORY   flag with FSOUND_Stream_Open to stream from memory.
00996            Use FSOUND_LOADRAW      flag with FSOUND_Stream_Open to treat stream as raw pcm data.
00997            Use FSOUND_MPEGACCURATE flag with FSOUND_Stream_Open to open mpegs in 'accurate mode' for settime/gettime/getlengthms.
00998            Use FSOUND_FREE as the 'channel' variable, to let FMOD pick a free channel for you.
00999 */
01000 
01001 DLL_API signed char        F_API FSOUND_Stream_SetBufferSize(int ms);      /* call this before opening streams, not after */
01002                            
01003 DLL_API FSOUND_STREAM *    F_API FSOUND_Stream_Open(const char *name_or_data, unsigned int mode, int offset, int length);
01004 DLL_API FSOUND_STREAM *    F_API FSOUND_Stream_Create(FSOUND_STREAMCALLBACK callback, int length, unsigned int mode, int samplerate, void *userdata);
01005 DLL_API signed char        F_API FSOUND_Stream_Close(FSOUND_STREAM *stream);
01006                            
01007 DLL_API int                F_API FSOUND_Stream_Play(int channel, FSOUND_STREAM *stream);
01008 DLL_API int                F_API FSOUND_Stream_PlayEx(int channel, FSOUND_STREAM *stream, FSOUND_DSPUNIT *dsp, signed char startpaused);
01009 DLL_API signed char        F_API FSOUND_Stream_Stop(FSOUND_STREAM *stream);
01010
